name: Acute Mesenteric Ischemia
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain that came on suddenly and won't go away
prognosis: Poor if not treated immediately (mortality 60-80%), better with early intervention
description: A life-threatening vascular emergency caused by sudden interruption of blood flow to the mesentery, leading to bowel ischemia and potential necrosis. Most commonly caused by embolism (50%), thrombosis (25%), or non-occlusive mesenteric ischemia (20%). Requires immediate surgical intervention.
